newsitem.title: GERMANY: Mobilcom shares soar on H1 earnings news.
newsitem.headline: Mobilcom shares soar on H1 earnings news.

text.p: FRANKFURT, July 30 - Shares of German mobile phone startup Mobilcom AG soared on Wednesday, climbing 17 percent after the company said pretax profit more than doubled in the first half of the year.
Shares traded at 155 marks at 1215 GMT, up from yesterday's close at 132 marks.

Earlier Mobilcom reported 10.84 million marks in first-half pretax profit, compared to 5.2 million marks the year-ago period. After-tax profit in the first six months of the year totaled 5.42 million marks -- beating the 5.4 million marks reported for all of 1996.

Mobilcom, which is traded on Frankfurt's New Market for midcap growth stocks, attributed the rise to a wave of new customers. At the end of June it had 190,000 customers, 29,000 more than at the beginning of the year.
The company's shares were issued at 62.50 marks on March 10, when the Frankfurt bourse lauched the New Market, an exchange modelled after New York's NASDAQ exchange.
